Checklist.Question: Does the unit satisfactorily meet the administrative requirements defined in the NAMP? Does a review of the CSEC 3500 area checklist reflect compliance?
Has a local SOP been published?
Are sufficient personnel available to ensure minimum crew manning levels at all times?
Does the Branch maintain a current copy of certification documentation for all installed equipment?
After each aircraft arrestment, is all data recorded onto the quarterly engagement report for submission to NAWC Lakehurst NJ? Is a negative report submitted quarterly if no arrestments occur?
Are effective procedures established to ensure that all incoming correspondence (letters, publications, etc.) are routed to the proper agency and acted upon promptly?
Does the Maintenance Training Program satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMPSOP? Does a review of the CSEC 200 program checklist reflect compliance?
Are all personnel assigned to the EAF section CPR Qualified?
Is the Marine Sierra Hotel Aviation Readiness Program (M-SHARP) used to track and monitor the Training and Readiness events for all Expeditionary Airfield Technicians assigned to the Squadron?
Has a T&R designation letter been completed for all Designations (Quality Assurance, Production Control, etc.)?
Is the Training and Readiness (T&R) syllabus evaluation form used and retained for 2 years?
Is the airfield vehicle operatorâ€™s course completed annually and documented, if applicable?
Is a Responsible Officer (RO) appointed in writing by the Commanding Officer?
Are the Table of Basic Allowance (TBA)/Consolidated Memorandum Receipt (CMR) assets being properly documented and inventoried by the section?
Checklist.Reference: MCO 4400.177F (TBA), chap 7; TBA update provided by APX 10/3 on 031715

Checklist.Question: Does the Mobile Maintenance Facilities Program satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMP? Does a review of the CSEC 5500 area checklist reflect compliance?
Has the section designated, in writing, personnel to submit/sign requisitions and receipt for materials?
Does Material Control satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMP? Does a review of the CSEC 3700 program checklist reflect compliance?
Checklist.Reference: CNAF 4790.2, chap 9; NAVSUP P-485 Vol II and III

Checklist.Question: Does the Tool Control Program satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMPSOP? Does a review of the CSEC 1300 program checklist reflect compliance?
Does the Naval Aviation Metrology and Calibration (METCAL) Program satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMPSOP? Does a review of the CSEC 2000 program checklist reflect compliance?
Does the Hazardous Material Control and Management (HMC&M) Program satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMPSOP? Does a review of the CSEC 2200 program checklist reflect compliance?
Does the Technical Directive (TD) Program satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMPSOP? Does a review of the CSEC 2600 program checklist reflect compliance?
Is a dedicated radio network available for recovery operations? Is the system functionally tested daily prior to flight operations?
If installed, is an aircraft emergency alarm system functionally tested with all related agencies on a daily basis prior to flight operations?
Does the work center maintain current copies of aircraft recovery bulletins?  Are work center personnel trained in their usage?
Is there a daily journal on hand to provide concise, chronological record of all activity pertaining to inspection, operation, and maintenance of all EAF or Shorebased systems?
Is the daily journal reviewed daily by the OIC, NCOIC, Runway Supervisor or Maintenance Control Chief?
Do Visual Information Display System/Maintenance Action Form (VIDS/MAF) procedures comply with established guidelines?

Does Maintenance/Production Control satisfactorily manage the maintenance program in accordance with the requirements defined in the NAMP? Does a review of the CSEC 2900 and 3000 area checklists reflect compliance?
Does the Foreign Object Damage (FOD) Prevention Program satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMPSOP? Does a review of the CSEC 1200 program checklist reflect compliance?
Does the Corrosion Prevention and Control Program satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMPSOP? Does a review of the CSEC 1400 program checklist reflect compliance?
Is an Aeronautical Equipment Service Record (AESR) established for all equipment?
Does Logs and Records satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMP? Does a review of the CSEC 3300 program checklist reflect compliance?
Does the Quality Assurance Audit Program satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMPSOP? Does a review of the CSEC 800 program checklist reflect compliance?
Does the unit satisfactorily meet the Safety Program requirements defined in the NAMP? Does a review of the CSEC 900 program checklist reflect compliance?

Does the Naval Aviation Maintenance Discrepancy Reporting Program (NAMDRP) satisfactorily meet the requirements defined in the NAMPSOP? Does a review of the CSEC 1000 program checklist reflect compliance?

Does the unit satisfactorily maintain the Central Technical Publications Library in accordance with the requirements defined in the NAMP? Does a review of the CSEC 1900 area checklist reflect compliance?
